properties.address: ShipShape Health and Wellbeing Centre, The Stables, Sharrow Lane, Sheffield, S11 8AE
properties.description: Established in 2006, ShipShape Health and Wellbeing is an Anchor organisation delivering responsive & preventive services to tackle health and inequality amongst the most deprived communities across the neighbourhoods of Nether Edge, Abbeydale, Highfield, Sharrow, Broomhall, and City Centre. As well as being well connected with city wide partners, groups and communities, through projects and partnership working. Our services are delivered from the centre and out in the community through our outreach team. the centre is open from 9:30am - 4pm. our services are delivered in different community languages through our diverse team of staff.
properties.title: ShipShape

properties.address: Christ Church Central, The DQ Centre, Fitzwilliam St, Sheffield City Centre, Sheffield S1 4JR
properties.description: Sundays -Sunday Church services, weekly at 10.30am and 6pm. -Weekly meeting for refugees, especially those who speak Farsi at 12.30 after the Morning services on Sundays. -Weekly internationals lunch on Sundays, free lunch for anyone who's first language is not English. -Weekly Free Student meal in the evening on Sundays. Monday - Mums and tots group running weekly during term time. - Olive Tree - a social space to asylum seekers and refugees to play games and go to a café. -International café- café for anyone who's first language is not English. -English class - Class for anyone wanting to improve their English. Friday - fortnightly women's bible study. - Youth group for ages 11-18. November - Christianity explored, a place to explore the message of Jesus. We are also hoping to open a workspace for anyone working remotely to come and have a social place to gather and work.
properties.title: Christ Church Central Sheffield

Arts & Crafts in november, 10am-12pm Wednesday mornings

properties.address: 81 Main Road, S9 5HL
properties.description: Free Wi Fi. Hot and cold drinks to welcome people. Music, books and toys/games and creative material for people to use. We also have a range of children and adult clothing which is free. Foodbank is held twice a week by voucher referrals. One day a week there is a Citizens Advice either by appointment or drop-in service for foodbank clients. Money support is available by appointment only. We host a monthly memory cafe for those with dementia prescribed run in co-operation with our local well-being team. There is a private car park and garden with seating for those wishing to enjoy flowers and plants. These activities are led by a small team of volunteers from our area.
